Articles.Content: Looks this thread... too mahy questions , how assembly MIR, how use soyuz, how land LK etc...
Shame the manual writer quit. I bet that there wouldn't be nearly as many questions if the Soviet Pack had those great .pdf manuals like it used to. I'm no manual writer, unfortunately.
PDF writer lost motivation. KSP its empty game on this moment.

Well, if you could find someone to format the manual and add pretty pictures, I could try writing some. There is a place for advanced features in KSP, people play with Deadly Reentry, FAR and other mods like that. Because it's fun. I've actually thought of making a set of configs for the Soviet pack that would allow it to use life support and Deadly Reentry, but I never got around to doing this. Some people would really like this, the extra challenge and realism. If newbies can't use those features, they don't have to. The capsule can withstand hard landing just fine.
Complex test N1+L3
has the original LK been changed in any way for this update?
I would be up for doing video manuals, but not into writing that much lol

I think i'm gonna make a trailer for this pack on my youtube channel(better than Bobcat's and of course i'll give credit to him). I could write but iv'e been super busy lately, so it would have to fit in my schedule. As mh60bhk said, Video manuals may be better than writing anyways(cause i don't like reading manuals).

Manual:

Step 1: Find common sense.

Step 2: Find school on how to use Common sense properly.

Step 3: Remember why you went to school for common sense in the first place.

Step 4: Re-download the Soviet pack as it's been several versions now while you were in school for common sense.

Step 5: Clean up mess of your mind being blown by new stuff.

Step 6: Probably should have told you to turn off that ceiling fan.

*rimshot*
lol, failed N1 launch, waiting rescue chopper in North pole. Jeb use LK shroud like windcover
HAHAHAHAHA! Perfect!
Tries to go to the Mun from a polar orbit. Space exploration level: Jebediah Kerman.

That's my MIR in LKO.

Thank you Bobcat for that wonderful mod.

Edited September 30, 2013 by TonUpBoy
Ahh... I had forgotten how beautiful it... need assembly MIR again.
Bobcat, How many tons can the Buran lift?

That's my MIR in LKO.

Thank you Bobcat for that wonderful mod.

How do you deploy those aerials on kavant 1 I cant seem to do that is it a part I have failed to put on

Edited September 30, 2013 by Virtualgenius

Bobcat, How many tons can the Buran lift?

i think 25 , 30 max.
BobCat, do you have any plans to make more Soviet spacecraft after N1-L3?

LOK orbital module interior

Edited September 30, 2013 by BobCat
Do want!. That needs to be a thing!
Looks nice. That should make docking to LK easier.

How do you deploy those aerials on kavant 1 I cant seem to do that is it a part I have failed to put on

The panels need to be added separately. Also, be sure that the panel attached to the MIR Core is aligned properly so that it opens parallel to the Kvant-2 module rather than through it.

Ahh... I had forgotten how beautiful it... need assembly MIR again.

It is beautiful indeed, here's mine, orbiting in the proper alignment relative to the planet below:

(I used the MIR Docking Module from Bilstech as well).
Is there going to be a new interior for the Soyuz Orbital module too? The LOK OM interior looks amazing. The Soyuz OM needs to be as great as this.
Looking forward to release of the N1! The videos look great!

How do you deploy those aerials on kavant 1 I cant seem to do that is it a part I have failed to put on

If you mean the girders, they are stockparts with Mir RCS at the end. I tried to build the Sofora and Rapana girders to hold experiments in space.

I assembled the Kvant 1 in the VAB.
